alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN SAN JUAN COUNTY THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 315 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sanostee, or 22 miles southwest of Shiprock, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shiprock, Sanostee and Rattlesnake. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 4 and 6, and between Mile Markers 9 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
